channel.title: [HELP] Compiling Problems [HELP]

item.title: [HELP] Compiling Problems [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @kneistol kneistol
item.description:
@kneistol wrote:

@echo off title demise's Compiler cd source "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin\javac.exe pause

if all of you can read there is an (x86) in the code he was showing us… so if you think he can use an old compiler your wrong

and for the problem i have fixed it… you have the latest java update right? the 21? you had the compiler on 20… so… no problem xD

and you have to cd into the source to compile in there u know

Read full topic

item.title: [HELP] Compiling Problems [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @Opium10 Opium10
item.description:
@Opium10 wrote:

Compiling Source javac: not a directory: .\Source/AccountScanner.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Compiling Players javac: directory not found: .\Players/*.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Done compiling Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic

item.title: [HELP] Compiling Problems [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @zoltanman zoltanman
item.description:
@zoltanman wrote:

@echo off title Sun chip's Compiler echo Compiling Source "C:/Program Files/Java\jdk1.6.0_20/bin/javac.exe" -d ./Source/*.java echo Compiling Players "C:/Program Files/Java\jdk1.6.0_20/bin/javac.exe" -d ./Players/*.java echo Done compiling pause

Oops my bad, try that one.

Read full topic

item.title: [HELP] Compiling Problems [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @Opium10 Opium10
item.description:
@Opium10 wrote:

Compiling Source javac: directory not found: ./bin Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Compiling Players javac: file not found: .\Players\*.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Press any key to continue . . .

Thats the error.

Read full topic

item.title: [HELP] Compiling Problems [HELP]

item.description:
@zoltanman wrote:

@echo off title Sun chip's Compiler echo Compiling Source "C:/Program Files/Java\jdk1.6.0_20/bin/javac.exe" -d ./bin ./Source/*.java echo Compiling Players "C:/Program Files/Java\jdk1.6.0_20/bin/javac.exe" -d ./bin ./Players/*.java pause

Try that…I have no idea if it’ll work

item.title: [HELP] Compiling Problems [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @Sun_Chips Sun Chips
item.description:
@Sun_Chips wrote:

try this

@echo off title Sun chip's Compiler "C:/Program Files/Java\jdk1.6.0_20/bin/javac.exe" -d ./bin ./src/*.java pause

@Sun_Chips wrote:

try this

@echo off title Sun's Compiler echo Compiling now... "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause

item.title: [HELP] Compiling Problems [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @Opium10 Opium10
item.description:
@Opium10 wrote:

Okay, so I’ve managed to finally download JDK1.6.0_20. I need some help with this now.

This is my Compiler Code;

@echo off title ********* Compiler "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin\javac.exe pause

This is the thing i get when i computer;

Press any key to continue . . .

But when it says that, it doesn’t compiler anything because i run the server and the print.miscln is still the same.

Thanks, All help is appreciated.

Read full topic
